page.title: 09KNOTTINGLEY SCHOOL LIFE
page.content: Our school is Knottingley Vale School,for children 5 to 12 years. For English work we use an ink pen. Inside its case is a wad of ink-soaked fibre.Ink flows onto the paper via a fibre tip.In number we do The School Mathematics Project.We work from cards which cover all aspects of number work including practical work.Our teacher writes on a blackboard with chalk.Each week we have 20 spellings to learn for a test.Sometimes we paint,using powder paint,draw,using charcoal,pencil or crayons,sew,make collages,balsa and clay models.Some children learn to play the 'cello,violin,flute,clarinet and recorder.Games played are netball, rounders,football and cricket. Assemblies are held Tuesday,Wednesday and Thursday.Classes lead the assembly in turn but the headmaster takes the assembly on Wednesday.
